meanings.definition: Not capable of being broken down into simpler substances.
meanings.sent1: The plastic bottle is nondegradable and will remain in the environment for hundreds of years.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reduce the use of nondegradable materials to protect the planet.
meanings.sent3: The nondegradable wrapper refused to decompose, much to the frustration of the composting enthusiast.
meanings.sent4: Her nondegradable resolve to finish the marathon inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The nondegradable bond between the two friends was unbreakable.

meanings.definition: Not subject to decomposition or decay.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was made of nondegradable material, preserving it for centuries.
meanings.sent2: Nondegradable substances like glass can last for a very long time without breaking down.
meanings.sent3: The nondegradable cake sat on the table for weeks, looking as fresh as the day it was baked.
meanings.sent4: His nondegradable enthusiasm for learning never wavered, even in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The nondegradable memories of their childhood adventures brought smiles to their faces.

meanings.definition: Unable to be degraded or broken down by natural processes.
meanings.sent1: The nondegradable chemicals in the soil posed a serious environmental threat.
meanings.sent2: Some nondegradable pollutants can accumulate in the ecosystem and harm wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The nondegradable stain on his shirt seemed to defy all attempts at removal.
meanings.sent4: Her nondegradable determination to succeed propelled her through difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The nondegradable impact of his words lingered long after he had spoken.
